definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: By 1916, more than half the states held presidential primaries.
sentences.chinese: 到1916年，有半数以上的州举行总统初选。

sentences.english: More than half had postgraduate degrees.
sentences.chinese: 超过半数以上拥有研究生学位。

sentences.english: Women head investment banking operations at Kotak Mahindra and JPMorgan Chase and the equities division of Icici. Half of the deputy governors at the Reserve Bank of India are women.
sentences.chinese: 印度储备银行半数以上的副理事都是由女性担任。

sentences.english: Half of patients have polymyalgia rheumatica.
sentences.chinese: 半数以上的病人有风湿性多肌痛。

sentences.english: But more than half of U.S. adults choose to take multivitamins, according to Lin.
sentences.chinese: 可是，半数以上的美国成年人服用维生素。

sentences.english: A quorum for meetings of the Board shall be a majority of its members.
sentences.chinese: 理事会会议的法定人数应是其成员国半数以上。

sentences.english: Malnutrition contributes to more than one third of all child deaths.
sentences.chinese: 营养不良促成半数以上的所有儿童死亡病例。

sentences.english: More than half of these wineries are in California.
sentences.chinese: 其中半数以上的葡萄酒酿造厂在加州。
